page.title: 02RHOSGOCH
page.content: Rhosgoch has recently gained more importance as a centre because in 1953 the area school was built there. This served the area of Llandeilo Graban, Painscastle and Newchurch where formerly there had been schools but are now closed. Rhosgoch is a hamlet built on the edge of the Red Bog, now an area of importance to the Nature Conservationists, by the B4594 road and under Pentre Hill in a valley. It is a beautiful, quiet place where a visitor wrote she 'saw a cuckoo in a larks nest'. New houses have been built in the last 15 years, mainly inhabited by newcomers to the area and retired people. In 1983 a golf club was built which hopes to provide entertainment for local people as well as golfers and this helps to foster a strong local spirit.
